channel.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
channel.description: Hi, I'm somewhat new to the RSPS programming scene but I have worked with programming for a long time, and other gaming API's, such as the bukkit API for minecraft, and i'm wondering is there a PI api or would it be possible to make I would love to hear a response.

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

An example was the plugin code in apollo, I found it near impossible to even give a player an item because you needed to create that item as an Item object which I couldn’t get to work in Ruby - this, coupled with the lack of documentation on the matter, made me stop trying

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

HcoJustin:

The plugin approach has been tried several times before and never really took off. It’s easier to just shove the shit code into the already bad server

The plugin approach has never really been made accessible to new developers though; most attempts have no documentation on the system what so ever and further more requires the understanding of multiple programming languages.

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:29, topic:510026”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=628271.msg4278220#msg4278220 date=1365202943]

Rather than making an API base specific something similar to Arhams would be a lot better. If I was making one for a specific framework I certainly wouldn’t go for PI, create one for something like RuneSource to boost activity and usage around a good framework.

when did arham ever make an API

making an api for a specific framework is stupid

He posted about it above.

??? that was me? LOL
[/quote]
He probably mistakened you for me because of our tutorial author badges being the same.[/quote]that’s because your oddish is bigger! You will evolve before him! o.0

@ claws api attempt how would you function this to skilling? Such as construction?

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:20, topic:510026”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=628271.msg4274810#msg4274810 date=1364854609]

Differentiation between player and server tasks?

Since this is external there isn’t any difference between Server and Player tasks (mainly because in the API there is no ‘Player’) but you can attach your task to a key Object and retrieve the task later if its still running (kind of like a Map, but not really) which means you can stop all tasks on logout of the player (the key would be the instance of the player).
[/quote]

How would you stop a single task of a single player then? If the key is the player.[/quote]
You’d need an instance of the task. If you want to stop any single task the key doesn’t matter

[code=java]Task task = …;

task.stop();[/code]

or

[code=java]Operation operation = new Operation();

operation.schedule(new Task(this, 1) {
@Override
public void run() {
… // whatever here

      this.stop();
 }

});[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:19, topic:510026”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=628271.msg4274751#msg4274751 date=1364852551]
Differentiation between player and server tasks?
[/quote]
Since this is external there isn’t any difference between Server and Player tasks (mainly because in the API there is no ‘Player’) but you can attach your task to a key Object and retrieve the task later if its still running (kind of like a Map, but not really) which means you can stop all tasks on logout of the player (the key would be the instance of the player).[/quote]

How would you stop a single task of a single player then? If the key is the player.

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Ambokile:

Differentiation between player and server tasks?

Since this is external there isn’t any difference between Server and Player tasks (mainly because in the API there is no ‘Player’) but you can attach your task to a key Object and retrieve the task later if its still running (kind of like a Map, but not really) which means you can stop all tasks on logout of the player (the key would be the instance of the player).

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Ambokile:

What’s “Operation”?

Operation.class Documentation:

This is the ‘command-center’ of the everything if you will. Carries out any operations that any classes in the API have to offer.

So basically lets you schedule tasks, open new listeners, stop tasks by key (or instance), etc.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: [IDEA][PI]possible API?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

lol @ the quote train

but yeah I took this idea and I’ve actually started working on an api that will work on any rsps. So far the outline looks like this

org.simple.event

Action
EventListener
EchoedEventListener

org.simple.task

Task
TaskSystem

org.simple.task.sequence

TaskSequencer
TaskSequencerAction

org.simple.operation

Operation

org.simple.util

SimpleTimer
SimpleCalendar
SimpleLogger

org.simple.err

SequencedTaskException

Should come in handy for people that need something more advanced than EventManager. TaskSequencer is pretty much the way I made those cutscenes, makes it 100x easier

Read full topic
